metadata.title: CVE-2014-0540 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
Adobe Flash Player before 13.0.0.241 and 14.x before 14.0.0.176 on Windowsand OS X and before 11.2.202.400 on Linux, Adobe AIR before 14.0.0.178 onWindows and OS X and before 14.0.0.179 on Android, Adobe AIR SDK before14.0.0.178, and Adobe AIR SDK & Compiler before 14.0.0.178 do not properlyrestrict discovery of memory addresses, which allows attackers to bypassthe ASLR protection mechanism via unspecified vectors, a differentvulnerability than CVE-2014-0542, CVE-2014-0543, CVE-2014-0544, andCVE-2014-0545.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-0540` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

flashplugin-downloader - 11.2.202.400
flashplugin-installer - 11.2.202.400
No subscription required

criterions.comment: flashplugin-nonfree package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '11.2.202.400').
